intro: Faradaya vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis faradaya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
